§Plugins

Seneca plugins enable you to build awesome microservices, incredibly fast. Some plugins are maintained in-house, while others are provided by the community.

On this page, we provide an npm link and total downloads per month for any plugins we find or publish ourselves, so you only need to look in one place.

gateway

  • gateway-lambda
  • gateway-auth

entity

  • entity-cache
  • entity-depend

provider

  • apimatic-provider
  • branchio-provider
  • checklyhq-provider
  • eventbrite-provider
  • evervault-provider
  • gcal-provider
  • github-provider
  • gitlab-provider
  • hubspot-provider
  • meetup-provider
  • mixpanel-provider
  • nordigen-provider
  • notion-provider
  • orbit-provider

§gateway_plugins

Description about gateway plugins.

§gateway-lambda

Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.

§gateway-auth

Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.

§entity_plugins

Description about entity plugins.

§entity-cache

Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.

§entity-depend

Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.

§provider_plugins

Description about provider plugins.

§apimatic-provider

Provides access to the Tangocard API using the Seneca provider convention. Tangocard API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§branchio-provider

Provides access to the Branchio API using the Seneca provider convention. Branchio API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§checklyhq-provider

Provides access to the Checkly API using the Seneca provider convention. Checkly API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§eventbrite-provider

Seneca provider for the eventbrite.com API.

§evervault-provider

Provides access to the Evervault API using the Seneca provider convention. Evervault API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§gcal-provider

Seneca plugin that provides access to the Google Calendar API.

§github-provider

Provides access to the Github API using the Seneca provider convention. Github API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§gitlab-provider

Provides access to the Gitlab API using the Seneca provider convention. Gitlab API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§hubspot-provider

Provides access to the Hubspot API using the Seneca provider convention. Hubspot API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§meetup-provider

Provides access to the Meetup API using the Seneca provider convention. Meetup API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§mixpanel-provider

Provides access to the Mixpanel API using the Seneca provider convention. Mixpanel API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§nordigen-provider

Provides access to the Nordigen API using the Seneca provider convention. Nordigen API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§notion-provider

Provides access to the Notion API using the Seneca provider convention. Notion API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§orbit-provider

Provides access to the Orbit API using the Seneca provider convention. Orbit API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§salesforce-provider

Seneca plugin that provides access to the SalesForce API.

§stytch-provider

Provides access to the Stytch API using the Seneca provider convention. Stytch API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§tangocard-provider

Provides access to the Tangocard API using the Seneca provider convention. Tangocard API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§trello-provider

Provides access to the Trello API using the Seneca provider convention. Trello API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§vercel-provider

Provides access to the Vercel API using the Seneca provider convention. Vercel API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§webflow-provider

Provides access to the Webflow CMS API using the Seneca provider convention. Webflow CMS API entities are represented as Seneca entities so that they can be accessed using the Seneca entity API and messages.

§zoom-provider

Seneca plugin that provides access to the Zoom API.

§customerio-provider

Seneca plugin that provides access to the customer.io API.

§Got a plugin to share?

Our docs are open source. Simply fork the senecajs.org repository, add your plugin to the appropriate section, and send us on a pull request - that way, other people can find your awesome plugin easily.

Issues? From spelling errors to broken tutorials and everything in between, report them here.
